dt: {bc}to go back or come back again
{bc}to go back in thought, practice, or condition {bc}{sx|revert||}
{bc}to pass back to an earlier possessor
{bc}to give (something, such as an official account) to a superior
{bc}to elect (a candidate) as attested by official report or {a_link|returns}
{bc}to bring back (something, such as a writ or verdict) to an office or tribunal
{bc}to bring, send, or put back to a former or proper place
{bc}to restore to a former or to a normal state
{bc}to cause (something, such as a wall) to continue in a different direction (as at a right angle)
{bc}to lead (a specified suit or specified card of a suit) in response to a partner's earlier lead
{bc}to run with (a football) after a change of possession (as by a punt or a fumble)

pt: {sc}reciprocate{/sc} {sc}retaliate{/sc} {sc}requite{/sc} {sc}return{/sc} mean to give back usually in kind or in quantity. {sc}reciprocate{/sc} implies a mutual or equivalent exchange or a paying back of what one has received.

pt.t: {it}reciprocated{/it} their hospitality by inviting them for a visit

pt: {sc}retaliate{/sc} usually implies a paying back of injury in exact kind, often vengefully.

pt.t: the enemy {it}retaliated{/it} by executing their prisoners

pt: {sc}requite{/sc} implies a paying back according to one's preference and often not equivalently.
{sc}return{/sc} implies a paying or giving back.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}returner{/it}, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}turner, tourner{/it} to turn {ma}{mat|turn|}{/ma}
shortdef: to go back or come back again
to go back in thought, practice, or condition : revert
to pass back to an earlier possessor

dt: {bc}the act of coming back to or from a place or condition
{bc}the delivery of a legal order (such as a writ) to the proper officer or court
{bc}an endorsed certificate stating an official's action in the execution of such an order
{bc}the sending back of a commission with the certificate of the commissioners
{bc}a report of the results of balloting
{bc}an official declaration of the election of a candidate
{bc}a formal statement on a required legal form showing taxable income, allowable deductions and exemptions, and the computation of the tax due
{bc}the continuation usually at a right angle of the face or of a member of a building or of a molding or group of moldings
{bc}a means for conveying something (such as water) back to its starting point
{bc}a quantity of goods, consignment, or cargo coming back in exchange for goods sent out as a mercantile venture
{bc}the value of or profit from such venture
{bc}the profit from labor, investment, or business {bc}{sx|yield||}
{bc}the rate of profit in a process of production per unit of cost
{bc}the act of returning something to a former place, condition, or ownership {bc}{sx|restitution||}
{bc}unsold publications returned to the publisher for cash or credit

dt.t: a {wi}return{/wi} on their years of hard work

dt: {bc}a lead in a suit previously led by one's partner in a card game
{bc}the action or an instance of returning a ball (as in football or tennis)

shortdef: the act of coming back to or from a place or condition
a regular or frequent returning : recurrence
the delivery of a legal order (such as a writ) to the proper officer or court

dt: {bc}a rate of yield that beyond a certain point fails to increase in proportion to additional investments of labor or capital
{bc}benefits that beyond a certain point fail to increase in proportion to extended efforts

shortdef: a rate of yield that beyond a certain point fails to increase in proportion to additional investments of labor or capital
benefits that beyond a certain point fail to increase in proportion to extended efforts

dt: used for wishing someone a happy birthday and to express the hope that he or she will live to celebrate many more birthdays in the future

shortdef: —used for wishing someone a happy birthday and to express the hope that he or she will live to celebrate many more birthdays in the future

dt: {bc}to go to (a place where one works, studies, etc.) again after being away for a time
{bc}to start doing or using (something) again especially after a long time

dt.t: She hopes to {it}return to{/it} working at home next week.

dt: {bc}to start an activity again that relates to (something)

dt.t: He {it}returned to{/it} his book after feeding the cat.

dt: {bc}to change back to (an earlier or original condition or state)

dt.t: She soon {it}returned to{/it} her old habits.

shortdef: to go to (a place where one works, studies, etc.) again after being away for a time
to start doing or using (something) again especially after a long time
to start an activity again that relates to (something)
